target_markets.market_description: Non-technical people wanting to build multi-agent workflows
pain_points: having to use custom code for multi-agent orchestration
technical barriers to building AI workflows
complex setup for chatbots on websites
target_markets.market_size_indicators: reducing barriers for non-technical people indicates large underserved market

problems_validated.problem: Building multi-agent workflows required custom code and technical expertise
problems_validated.severity: high - created barrier to entry for non-technical users
problems_validated.current_solutions: custom code to create parallel sequence or multi-agent orchestration, third party chatbot services
problems_validated.market_gap: no visual interface for building agent workflows without coding

products_tools.name: OpenAI Agent Builder
products_tools.use_case: visual interface for building multi-agent workflows without code

products_tools.name: OpenAI ChatKit
products_tools.use_case: SDK to connect agent builder workflows to front-end chatbots

products_tools.name: OpenAI Widgets
products_tools.use_case: dynamic UI components for chat interfaces to display data

products_tools.name: Shopify MCP integration
products_tools.use_case: pulling Shopify store data into chat interfaces

business_strategies.strategy: Use AI agents to classify customers vs leads and route them to appropriate workflows
business_strategies.implementation: Build classifier agent that determines if user is existing customer or new lead, then route to either support agent or lead capture agent
business_strategies.expected_results: automated customer service and lead qualification
business_strategies.case_study: demo chatbot that classifies users and either answers support tickets or captures lead information

problems_solutions.problem: Building chatbots that can distinguish between customers and leads
problems_solutions.solution: Use OpenAI Agent Builder with classifier agent and conditional logic
steps: Create separate agents for support vs lead capture
Connect to vector store for knowledge base

startup_ideas.idea: Custom chatbot service using OpenAI's new tools
startup_ideas.target_market: businesses needing customer service and lead qualification automation
startup_ideas.problem_solved: manual customer service and lead qualification processes
startup_ideas.validation: build demo chatbot and test with real customer interactions

growth_tactics.tactic: Create educational content showing how to build AI workflows
growth_tactics.results_expected: educate audience on new AI capabilities

steps: Classifier agent determines if customer or lead
Logic node routes based on classification
If customer: support agent answers using knowledge base
If lead: capture information and route to sales team
ai_workflows.use_case: automated customer service and lead qualification

trends_signals.trend: Visual no-code interfaces for AI agent building
trends_signals.opportunity: democratizes AI development for non-technical users
businesses can automate complex processes with multiple AI agents working together

actionable_quotes.quote: The key takeaway here is that it's essentially reducing the barrier for non-technical people to get started with building multi-agent workflows
actionable_quotes.context: discussing OpenAI's new Agent Builder visual interface
actionable_quotes.actionability: focus on serving non-technical market segment for AI tools

actionable_quotes.quote: You're essentially it's very meta. You're using an agent to create agents agent prompts
actionable_quotes.context: explaining how to use ChatGPT to generate prompts for other agents
actionable_quotes.actionability: use AI to help build better AI workflows and prompts

meta.title: OpenAI's NEW Agent Builder and ChatKit are INSANE
